EU continues to hesitate on how to pressure Israel
subhead: Despite the damning report presented on Thursday by the European Union foreign minister detailing violations of international law committed by Netanyahu's government, the 27 member states could not agree on whether to suspend the Association Agreement with Israel. The decision was postponed until mid-July.

title: Europe reluctant to confront the United States on tariffs
subhead: European leaders thrashed out a trade strategy with the United States at a summit in Brussels, ahead of a July 9 tariff deadline. Germany is pushing for a conciliatory approach, while France is calling for a firm hand.

title: Zohran Mamdani's meteoric rise in New York signals a widespread desire for change among Democrats
subhead: The progressive candidate is now the frontrunner in New York City's mayoral election, set for November, after defeating former state governor Andrew Cuomo, a symbol of the moderate local elite, in the Democratic primary.

title: Five cultural outings to enjoy with a baby in Paris
subhead: Sensory tours at the Musée Rodin and Musée de l'Orangerie, mezzo forte concerts from the Orchestre Lamoureux, joyful splashing at Centquatre-Paris: More and more cultural venues in the French capital are offering activities for children under the age of two.

title: Former French PM Gabriel Attal: 'I do not see a shared vision for society' with conservatives
subhead: Economically liberal, tough on state authority and progressive on social issues... The former French prime minister, now leading Macron's party Renaissance, lays out for Le Monde the political direction he hopes to champion for 2027.

title: Japan is questioning its alliance with Donald Trump's United States
subhead: Faced with Trump's unpredictable policies, Japanese leaders are considering the need to develop an alternative diplomatic and security strategy to reduce their dependence on the US.

title: Has the Mendelssohn Stradivarius, stolen by the Nazis, been found?
subhead: An investigation by an American academic asserts the 'Small Mendelssohn,' an exceptional violin taken from the Mendelssohn family during World War II, is the same instrument as the 'Stella,' the magnificent violin currently played by Japanese virtuoso Eijin Nimura. He denies that.
